com.radirius.mercury.graphics

Class Shader

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.radirius.mercury.graphics.Shader
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Resource, java.lang.Cloneable

    public class Shader
extends java.lang.Object
implements Resource
    An object version of shaders. Does all of the tedious stuff for you and lets you use the shader easily.

    Note that if you are using custom shader, you can not add more attributes. You can only define uniforms, do so before calling the rendering operation. Here is a list of locations of the attributes, make sure you don't break it in the vertex shader.

    Location Attribute
    0 in vec2 position
    1 in vec4 color
    2 in vec2 texCoords

    For most of the cases, the default shader is fine. Only add a custom shader if you think that the default one isn't sufficient.

    Author:
    wessles, opiop65, Jeviny, Sri Harsha Chilakapati
